events.title: UN human rights rapporteur applies to join legal case against protest laws ‚Äì as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Albanese defends Isaac Herzog‚Äôs Australia visit as federal MP joins calls to rescind invitation Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Anne Aly says it is ‚Äòhuge relief‚Äô there were no casualties at Perth Invasion Day rally Anne Aly, the minister for multicultural affairs, as well as a counter-terrorism expert, says she is relieved no one was hurt in the potential terrorist act as an improvised explosive device was thrown into a crowd at an Invasion Day rally in Perth. Well, first of all, I guess it was relief, really, that nobody was hurt. When you throw an IED, an improvised explosive device, into a crowd, and if it‚Äôs a successful, it could have been a mass casualty attack. So the huge relief that nobody was hurt. The distinction we need to draw here when we say David Littleproud has done X, Y, Z ‚Ä¶ David Littleproud [has] only done that because the room has agreed to do that and he has requested what is the room‚Äôs view ‚Ä¶ David Littleproud has never run off and done anything unless he has had the complete support of the Nationals party room. Continue reading...

events.title: Albanese defends Isaac Herzog‚Äôs Australia visit as federal MP joins calls to rescind invitation
events.description: Independent MP Sophie Scamps joins Labor‚Äôs Friends of Palestine group and Greens senator Mehreen Faruqi in objecting to Israeli president‚Äôs visit Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Anthony Albanese has defended the government‚Äôs invitation to Israeli president, Isaac Herzog, to visit, after another federal MP joined calls to cancel the visit after the Bondi terror attack. Herzog‚Äôs arrival in February will be met by a ‚Äúmajor security response‚Äù in Sydney and planned protests nationwide from pro-Palestinian groups demonstrating against the civilian death toll from Israel‚Äôs war on Gaza. Continue reading...

events.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
events.description: More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters. More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain . Continue reading...

events.title: Ukraine is facing 'humanitarian catastrophe,' EU warns
events.description: Kaja Kallas, the EU's top diplomat, says Ukraine is facing a humanitarian catastrophe under Russia's bombing. Three people were killed in a Russian drone attack in southern Ukraine Thursday, officials say. Follow DW.

events.title: Iran-US rhetoric "raises spectre of war" but both still use intermediary talking channels
events.description: Trump has repeatedly threatened to intervene if Iran continued to kill protesters, but the countrywide demonstrations over economic privations and political repression have since abated. He has said the United States would act if Tehran resumed its nuclear program after the June airstrikes ‚Äçby Israeli and U.S. forces on key nuclear installations. Iran has said it is ready to retaliate if needed. But according to FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah, speaking from Tehran, both parties are still talking through intermediary channels.

events.title: Ivory Coast's cocoa growers face crisis amid drop in global prices
events.description: Ivory Coast says it will start buying back thousands of tons of unsold cocoa that have been sitting in warehouses and around the country's ports since November 2026. The holdup has also seen the income of farmers stagnate in the world‚Äôs largest producer of the cacao. But many worry that the last-minute intervention maybe too little too late.

events.title: EU to label Iran guards as terror group after deadly crackdown on protesters
events.description: The European Union appeared poised on January 29 to sanction Iran‚Äôs paramilitary Revolutionary Guard over Tehran‚Äôs deadly crackdown on nationwide protests, further squeezing the Islamic Republic as it worries over a threat by U.S. President Donald Trump to potentially launch a military strike against it. Videos that have emerged from Iran via Starlink satellite dishes and other means show men likely belonging to its forces shooting and beating protesters. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert tell us more.

events.title: Live: Iran's army chief vows 'crushing response' as US tensions simmer
events.description: Iran's army chief Amir Hatami on Thursday vowed a "crushing response" to any attack after the United States moved a fleet of warships into regional waters. The ‚ÄãIranian ‚Äçarmy also said that it had received a batch of 1,000 drones amid growing tensions, with US President Donald Trump warning of an attack ‚Äçif Tehran refused a ‚Äãnuclear deal. Follow our liveblog for updates.

events.title: Trump hangs a 'nice' photo of himself and Putin in the White House
events.description: PRESS REVIEW ‚Äì Thursday, January 29: International papers are reacting to the "ultraviolence of ICE agents" and commenting on Trump's latest White House decoration choice. Elsewhere, Serbia and Georgia are weaponising surveillance technologies against pro-democracy and anti-government protests. Finally, a two-year-old snooker prodigy wins multiple Guinness World Records.

events.title: Latest Trump-Iran escalation is "a new shiny object" taking focus off Minneapolis
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump ‚Å†urged Iran on Wednesday to come to the table and make a deal on nuclear weapons or the next U.S. attack would be far worse. Tehran responded with a threat to strike back against the United States, Israel and those who support them. Yet, it is unclear what Trump actually wants: regime change, nuclear talks, or something for Iranian protesters who have suffered a brutal, deadly crackdown. What's for sure is that it is taking focus off Trump's political struggles back home, says FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert.

events.title: UN chief warns ‚Äòlaw of the jungle‚Äô is replacing rule of law
events.description: Warning that the ‚Äúrule of law is being replaced by the law of the jungle,‚Äù the UN Secretary-General on Monday urged world powers to recommit to international law as the foundation of peace, justice and multilateral cooperation.

events.title: American extremist admits bankrolling ISIS terrorists, plotting US violence with homemade bomb: feds
events.description: A California man pleaded guilty to sending over $1,600 to ISIS fighters and possessing a homemade bomb packed with metal fragments in a federal terrorism case.

events.title: US congressman meets five-year-old Liam Ramos and his father at ICE detention center ‚Äì as it happened
events.description: This blog has now closed. Read our latest story here Two federal officers fired their guns during the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti , according to an initial review by the Department of Homeland Security that was obtained by NBC News . Three sources told NBC News that the preliminary report, from a Customs and Border Protection internal investigation led by the agency‚Äôs Office of Professional Responsibility, was sent to congressional committees yesterday, including the House homeland security and judiciary committees. Continue reading...

events.title: Sicilian town impacted by landslide fears it risks widening as 1,500 evacuated
events.description: The Sicilian town of Niscemi has been declared a "red zone" after a four-kilometre (2.5-mile) long stretch of the hillside collapsed on January 25, forcing the evacuation of some 1,500 people. The town, built on unstable terrain, was battered by a powerful storm which hit southern Italy a few days before. Though there were no deaths or injuries, experts say the gulf could extend -- and topple more houses -- when it rains again. Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni visited on January 28.

events.title: Remembering the Holocaust: ‚ÄòYou are here because you choose hope over hate‚Äô
events.description: The Holocaust is a warning, that hatred ‚Äúcan consume everything‚Äù ‚Äì a message that feels more urgent than ever, the UN chief said on Tuesday, as antisemitism rages worldwide.

events.title: Video captures emergency crews rescuing dog trapped in icy lake during single-digit temperatures
events.description: Fire department rescues stranded dog from icy Missouri lake in dramatic mission captured on video. Dog expected to make full recovery after rescue operation.

events.title: How Israel‚Äôs West Bank security realities are reshaping the two-state debate
events.description: The West Bank remains central to Israel's security strategy as experts debate two-state solution viability following declining Palestinian terrorist incidents.

events.title: EU set to put Iran Revolutionary Guards on 'terrorist' list
events.description: The bloc's foreign ministers are expected to make the symbolic move at a meeting in Brussels, in response to the brutal clampdown on protests in Iran.

events.title: US withdrawal from WHO ‚Äòrisks global safety‚Äô, agency says in detailed rebuttal
events.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a detailed statement regretting the United States decision to leave the UN agency, and declaring that it will leave both the US and the world less safe as a result.

events.title: Thursday briefing: Will Keir Starmer‚Äôs cautious China gamble pay off?
events.description: In today‚Äôs newsletter: With China now central to the world‚Äôs green tech‚Äã and economic future, the UK faces a ‚Äãs‚Äãeries of strategic ‚Äãdiscussions it can no longer postpone Good morning. The Starmer has landed. Yesterday, Keir Starmer became the first British prime minister to make the trip to China since Theresa May‚Äôs in 2018 (meaning a surprisingly large number of PMs didn‚Äôt) and has vowed to bring ‚Äústability and clarity‚Äù to the UK‚Äôs approach to Beijing . Iran | Donald Trump has warned time is running out for Tehran and said a massive US armada was moving quickly towards the country. Assisted Dying | Supporters of assisted dying will seek to force through the bill using an archaic parliamentary procedure if it continues to be blocked by the Lords. UK politics | Centrist ideas are no longer wanted in the Conservative party, Kemi Badenoch has said. Ofsted | A snap inspection of a Bristol secondary school criticised for postponing a visit by an MP who is a member of a group that advocates for Israel has found ‚Äúno evidence of partisan political views‚Äù. BBC | The BBC has named senior executive Rhodri Talfan Davies as its interim director general , as the corporation continues the search for a permanent replacement for Tim Davie. Continue reading...

events.title: Inquiry calls for ban on ‚Äòglobalise the intifada‚Äô in NSW ‚Äì but only when used to incite hatred and violence
events.description: Opposition ‚Äòdeeply unimpressed‚Äô with recommendation that ‚Äòadds nothing except confusion‚Äô, shadow attorney general says Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A New South Wales parliamentary inquiry has recommended banning the phrase ‚Äúglobalise the intifada‚Äù when it is used to incite hatred, harassment, intimidation or violence, but won‚Äôt call for banning the statement outright or recommend a ban on phrases such as ‚Äúfrom the river to sea‚Äù. The Labor MP Edmond Atalla, the chair of the inquiry, confirmed the draft recommendations to Guardian Australia ahead of a final closed meeting on Thursday, at which the Labor-led committee voted to table the report almost entirely unchanged. Continue reading...

events.title: ‚Äòtr*nsgender ANTIFA‚Äô extremist charged with attempted murder after skating on death threat, Rep Mace says
events.description: Suspected Antifa extremist allegedly threatened Rep. Nancy Mace with assassination, prosecutors ignored warnings, now charged with attempted murder in Portland.

events.title: Planes hit by gunfire and blasts heard at airport in Niger capital ‚Äì reports
events.description: Source says two aircraft on ground ‚Äòdestroyed‚Äô although authorities yet to comment on situation Gunfire and loud blasts have been heard at the main airport in the Nigerien capital of Niamey, according to the Reuters news agency and an independent source. A witness told Reuters they heard explosions just after midnight. The airport is next to Base A√©rienne 101, a military base previously used by American and then Russian troops . Continue reading...

events.title: Greetings from Mumbai, where residents take breathing space where they can find it
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: ‚ÄòWe must stand up for our shared humanity - each and every day‚Äô: UN human rights chief
events.description: On the eve of International Holocaust Remembrance Day, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker T√ºrk called on the global community to ‚Äúnot only to look at our past, but to reflect on our present, and to safeguard our future.‚Äù

events.title: South Sudan: UN and rights experts warn against risk of mass violence in Jonglei
events.description: The UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) is sounding the alarm over the threat of escalating violence in Jonglei state which is putting lives at risk and further weakening prospects for peace.

events.title: Video: US agents placed on leave over Pretti shooting as vigil held
events.description: US federal agents involved in a fatal shooting during an immigration raid are placed on leave. Manuel Rapalo explains.

events.title: Minneapolis gathers for candlelight vigil in honour of Alex Pretti
events.description: Two agents involved in the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis have been placed on administrative leave. The killing has provoked public outcry across the US - and put the Trump administration on the backfoot as calls escalate for the removal of the head of the Department of Homeland Security. Despite saying he wanted to deescalate a little bit - President Donald Trump again ramped up the rhetoric on January 28 - accusing the mayor of Minneapolis of playing with fire. Meanwhile the community gathered for a candlelight vigil in the city to honour the life of Alex Pretti.

events.title: Video appears to show Alex Pretti spit at federal agents, violently damage SUV days before fatal CBP shooting
events.description: Newly released video appears to show Alex Pretti confronting federal agents before his fatal Minneapolis shooting during enforcement operations.

events.title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
events.description: State ariline Satena says its aircraft carrying 13 passengers and two crew "suffered a fatal accident".

events.title: Philippines: Shariff Aguak mayor Akmad Ampatuan survives RPG attack
events.description: üö® Three suspects were killed during a pursuit operation after allegedly attacking Shariff Aguak‚Äôs Mayor, Akmad Ampatuan, in the Philippines. üí• The assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade at the mayor‚Äôs bulletproof utility vehicle before fleeing in a white minivan. ‚ùï The motive for the attack remains unknown.

events.title: Joel Osteen's Lakewood Church remembers staff member killed in Maine plane crash: 'Beautiful spirit'
events.description: Joel Osteen's Lakewood Church said a staff member who ‚Äúpossessed a beautiful spirit" was among the victims of a fatal private jet crash in Bangor, Maine.

events.title: Multiple people injured after gunfire erupts at funeral home during teen's service with hundreds in attendance
events.description: Six people were injured in a shooting at a teenager's funeral in Ferguson, Missouri, authorities confirmed. Hundreds of mourners were in attendance when gunfire erupted.

events.title: Iranian security forces gun down amateur boxer near Tehran: source
events.description: Iranian security forces allegedly killed amateur boxer Sepehr Ebrahimi during ongoing protests near Tehran. The death adds to Iran's rising protest toll of at least 6,126 people killed.

events.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal as US military builds up in Gulf
events.description: Tehran says its armed forces are ready "with their fingers on the trigger" to respond to any aggression.

events.title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs the sovereignty of the country‚Äô: Guinea-Bissau says US vaccine study suspended
events.description: Despite US pushback, officials in west Africa say controversial hepatitis B study on pause amid ethics concerns US health officials insisted it was still on. African health leaders said it was cancelled . At the heart of the controversy is the west African nation of Guinea-Bissau ‚Äì one of the poorest countries in the world and the proposed site of a hotly debated US-funded study on vaccines. The study on hepatitis B vaccination, to be led by Danish researchers, became a flashpoint after major changes to the US vaccination schedule and prompted questions about how research is conducted ethically in other countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Climate change worsened rains, floods which killed dozens in southern Africa: Study
events.description: Researchers say human-induced climate change worsened recent torrential rains and floods in southern Africa

events.title: Russian drone attack on passenger train is an ‚Äòact of terrorism,‚Äô Zelenskyy says
events.description: Russian drones struck a passenger train in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, killing five in what Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called an act of terrorism.

events.title: Ted Cruz urges US to arm Iranian protesters as militias threaten ‚Äòtotal war‚Äô against America
events.description: Ted Cruz responds to reports describing rapidly deteriorating situation as Iran-backed militias threaten 'total war' against America. He called for the U.S. to arm Iranian protesters.

events.title: Haiti faces a sexual violence and abuse crisis as gang violence spreads
events.description: As gang violence in Haiti surges, sexual violence is increasingly a problem. The number of victims being treated at one clinic in Port au Prince has tripled in the past four years. Doctors Without Borders said it was ‚Äúalarmed and outraged‚Äù by the overwhelming level of sexual and gender-based violence. Gangs control an estimated 90% of Port-au-Prince, with many resorting to sexual abuse to instill fear, experts say.

events.title: Ukraine intensifies deepstrikes against Russia with domestically-produced weapons
events.description: Since August 2025 Ukraine has stepped up its campaign of strikes against targets deep inside Russia. While the country‚Äôs Western allies have been reluctant to allow the use of long-range missiles for that purpose, they have not objected to Ukraine doing it with its domestically-produced weapons - principally drones ‚Äì with the Americans even helping with targeting, according to various sources. Our correspondent Gulliver Cragg gained exclusive access to the launch of one of these attacks.

events.title: At least 11 killed in second deadly minibus-truck crash in a week
events.description: At least 11 people have been killed in a crash between a truck and a minibus taxi in South Africa - the second such incident in recent days.

events.title: At least 11 killed in a crash involving a minibus taxi and a truck in South Africa
events.description: A crash involving a minibus taxi and a truck has killed at least 11 people in South Africa

events.title: From lunch tray to lifelong health: WHO sets global standards for school meals
events.description: For the first time ever, the World Health Organization (WHO) is providing recommendations for healthy and nutritious food in schools around the world.

events.title: Man who nearly beat Chicago train passenger to death walks free with no prison time: report
events.description: CTA passenger allegedly beaten into coma with brain injuries, broken ribs won't see attacker serve prison time under current Illinois sentencing laws.

events.title: Combined war casualties for Russia and Ukraine could hit 2 million, new report warns
events.description: A new CSIS report warns Russia-Ukraine war casualties could reach 2 million by spring 2026, with Russia reportedly suffering 1.2 million casualties so far.

events.title: ActionAid to rethink child sponsorship as part of plan to ‚Äòdecolonise‚Äô its work
events.description: Development charity‚Äôs new co-chief executives signal shift from controversial sponsor a child scheme launched in 1972 to long-term grassroots funding Child sponsorship schemes that allow donors to handpick children to support in poor countries can carry racialised, paternalistic undertones and need to be transformed, the newly appointed co-chief executives of ActionAid UK said as they set out to ‚Äúdecolonise‚Äù the organisation‚Äôs work. ActionAid began in 1972 by finding sponsors for schoolchildren in India and Kenya, but Taahra Ghazi and Hannah Bond have launched their co-leadership this month with the goal of shifting narratives around aid from sympathy towards solidarity and partnership with global movements. Continue reading...

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.description: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: The leaders of Britain and China called Thursday for a ‚Äúcomprehensive strategic partnership‚Äù to deepen ties between their nations at a time of growing global turbulence and uncertainty. Neither Prime Minister Keir Starmer nor President Xi Jinping publicly mentioned Donald Trump, but the U.S. president's challenge to the post-Cold War order was clearly on their minds. FRANCE 24's Jan Camenzind Broomby tells us more from Beijing.

events.title: Gulf shipping operations grind to halt near Iran; US quietly prepares for possible strike: 'Heightened risk'
events.description: Maritime intelligence warns of heightened risks for U.S.-flagged vessels in the Persian Gulf as Iran threatens an "immediate, all-out" response to any American military action.

events.title: Trump admin rewrites nuclear safety rules. And, NTSB releases findings on D.C. crash
events.description: NPR obtains documents showing the Trump administration secretly cut nuclear safety rules to fast-track new reactors. And, investigators blame systemic failures for a deadly midair crash near D.C.

events.title: Mozambique relaunches TotalEnergies gas project after five-year pause
events.description: Mozambique and TotalEnergies on Thursday relaunched a $20 billion gas project that was halted nearly five years ago after a deadly jihadist attack killed an estimated 800 people.

events.title: Russian drone attack kills 3 in southern Ukraine as further US-led peace talks approach
events.description: A Russian drone attack has killed three people in southern Ukraine, authorities said Thursday

events.title: Video appears to show Alex Pretti spit at agents, damage SUV days before fatal shooting and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.description: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: ‚ÄòCycle of attacks must end‚Äô: Lead UN official in Ukraine
events.description: The senior UN official in Ukraine, Matthias Schmale, has issued a condemnation of the massive overnight Russian drone and missile strike on several major Ukrainian cities, killing and injuring civilians, and knocking out energy infrastructure amid sub-zero temperatures.

events.title: Viral ‚Äòbananas and rice‚Äô Somali woman arrested for allegedly participating in Minneapolis riot
events.description: The viral "bananas and rice" woman was among 16 arrested during the Minneapolis riots as federal authorities escalate enforcement after deadly clashes with protesters.

events.title: China slams Trump administration over US sanctions on Cuba
events.description: China strongly condemns U.S. pressure on Cuba, calling sanctions violations of international law as diplomatic tensions escalate over decades-long embargo.

events.title: Why is India‚Äôs Nipah virus outbreak spooking the world?
events.description: The virus spreads from animals to humans, via person-to-person contact or through consuming contaminated food.

events.title: Can Venezuela‚Äôs Delcy Rodr√≠guez become a Latin American Deng Xiaoping?
events.description: Maduro‚Äôs Sorbonne-educated successor is talking up an era of ‚Äòreform and opening up‚Äô modelled on China‚Äôs post-Mao boom After years of political and social upheaval, hunger and despair, the Great Helmsman departs and is replaced by a francophile economic reformer who catapults a traumatised country into a new era of prosperity and growth . That is what happened in China half a century ago when the croissant-loving communist Deng Xiaoping became paramount leader after Chairman Mao Zedong‚Äôs 1976 death and set in motion one of history‚Äôs biggest economic booms. Continue reading...

events.title: At least five killed after Storm Kristin hits Portugal
events.description: The storm toppled trees, damaged homes and left more than 800,000 people without power.

events.title: If Cuba falls, the Global South is to blame, too
events.description: As the United States tightens the screws, Cuba‚Äôs supposed allies respond with empty gestures and selective solidarity.

events.title: Colombia plane crash: All 15 passengers on board killed
events.description: The aircraft carrying 15 people, including Congressman Diogenes Quintero, made last contact with air traffic control shortly after takeoff.

events.title: Lagos protesters denounce the destruction of floating Makoko slum
events.description: Nigerian police ‚Äçfired tear gas to ‚Äãdisperse residents protesting in Lagos on January 28 over demolition work in ‚Å†one of Africa's largest floating slums, the Makoko slum, that has displaced thousands of people. Lagos state officials, with the help of ‚Äãarmed police and excavators, have been demolishing homes arguing that residents illegally built ‚Äãtheir houses - mostly wooden shacks built on stilts above ‚Äãthe water - near high-voltage power lines.

events.title: Senior politician dies in India plane crash
events.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has paid tribute after a minister was killed in a plane crash which left no survivors.

events.title: Thai Air Force says 2 pilots killed in plane crash during training mission
events.description: Two Thai Air Force pilots have died in a plane crash during a training mission

events.title: From deepfakes to grooming: UN warns of escalating AI threats to children
events.description: The staggering amount of harmful AI-generated online content has prompted an urgent call from across the UN system for a raft of measures to protect children from abuse, exploitation and mental trauma.

events.title: Second teen dies after Texas sledding accident that killed best friend: ‚ÄòThey were holding on to each other‚Äô
events.description: Texas community mourns loss of two high school sophomores killed in sledding accident. Grace Brito was a cheerleader, Elizabeth Angle played soccer.

events.title: Illinois teen stabs pregnant woman 70 times, knifes dog, sets home ablaze during Facebook Marketplace meetup
events.description: An Illinois teenager allegedly stabbed a pregnant mother to death dozens of times during a Facebook Marketplace meetup before setting the home on fire.

events.title: Commercial flight vanishes before crashing in Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including congressman
events.description: A plane crash in Colombia killed 15 near the Venezuela border with a congressman aboard. Search teams have confirmed no survivors were found.

events.title: Netanyahu sounds alarm on antisemitism at Holocaust Remembrance Day gathering
events.description: Antisemitism surge prompts leaders to gather in Jerusalem for Holocaust Remembrance Day conference. Netanyahu warns ideology threatens Western civilization.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Burnham claims Labour figures ‚Äòlied‚Äô about him to media after he was blocked as byelection candidate ‚Äì¬†UK politics live
events.description: Burnham said that he accepted the party‚Äôs decision but the incident had exposed a ‚Äòlying‚Äô culture For more context on today‚Äôs Starmer - Xi meeting, China is the world‚Äôs second-biggest economy and Britain‚Äôs third-largest trading partner ‚Äì to which it exports ¬£45bn of goods and services a year ‚Äì so it is no surprise the UK has turned to Beijing in its search for economic reliability. As the Guardian‚Äôs political editor Pippa Crerar reported earlier today, the UK does not rank among the top 10 of China‚Äôs trading partners but the Beijing leadership has spied a political opportunity to improve links with one of Washington‚Äôs closest allies at a time of deep uncertainty in the transatlantic alliance. Continue reading...

events.title: Marco Rubio tells senators Venezuela transition won't be fast or easy
events.description: At his first Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing since U.S. forces seized Nicol√°s Maduro, Secretary of State Marco Rubio warns the U.S. could still use force to pressure Venezuela's government.

events.title: Doctors share disturbing accounts of Iran crackdown
events.description: In Iran, the climate of fear has been restored after the clerics who run this country successfully crushed a nationwide revolt.

events.title: Small plane crashes in rural area of Colombia, killing 15 people including congressman
events.description: Authorities say a small plane has crashed in a rural area of Norte de Santander province in northeast Colombia, killing 15 people including a congressman

events.title: World News in Brief: Deadly shipwrecks in the Mediterranean, Duterte trial update, final hostage remains recovered in Gaza, FAO boosts farming in Haiti
events.description: The UN migration agency, IOM, expressed deep concern on Monday over multiple deadly shipwrecks that are believed to have taken place over the past ten days across the Central Mediterranean.

events.title: Substance sprayed on Rep Ilhan Omar reportedly identified as apple cider vinegar; FBI investigating
events.description: A man accused of attacking Rep. Ilhan Omar at a town hall event allegedly sprayed apple cider vinegar on the congresswoman. Anthony James Kazmierczak, 55, is charged with assault.

events.title: Filipino mayor unharmed after apparent RPG attack on car in broad daylight
events.description: Mayor Akmad Ampatuan was unharmed after attackers targeted his vehicle with an apparent rocket-propelled grenade in the southern province of Maguindanao del Sur.

events.title: Heavy gunfire and blasts heard near airport in Niger's capital
events.description: The airport houses an air force base and is about 10km (six miles) from the presidential place.

events.title: Man guilty of assault after Barron Trump reported attack to UK police
events.description: Donald Trump's son told officers he had seen the victim being beaten up during a video call in January 2025.

events.title: Minnesota: Agents in Pretti shooting placed on leave ‚Äî media
events.description: Two agents involved in the shooting of Alex Pretti have reportedly been placed on leave. Meanwhile, a suspect who targeted Democratic congresswoman Ilhan Omar has a criminal history and made pro-Trump posts, police say.

events.title: Meta & Microsoft earnings reports underline huge AI spending, raise profitability questions
events.description: Both Meta Platforms and Microsoft shared their latest quarterly results on Wednesday and showed they are still planning on sustained spending on artificial intelligence. Similarly, Telsa posted a drop in annual revenue for the first time in its history and announced a shift away from electric vehicles and towards AI and robotics. Meanwhile, hardware providers like Samsung Electronics are fuelling the boom in AI, and reaping the benefits.

events.title: Security Council LIVE: Ambassadors debate as Middle East crises mount
events.description: The UN Security Council is holding a high-level open debate on the Middle East which is expected to focus on the Gaza peace plan ‚Äì including the role of President Donald Trump‚Äôs Board of Peace ‚Äì the continuing humanitarian crisis in the enclave and turmoil in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, following the demolition of UNRWA‚Äôs headquarters there. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Driver rams car repeatedly into doors of NYC Jewish site, suspect detained
events.description: A driver was taken into custody after police say the individual intentionally and repeatedly rammed a vehicle into the Chabad Lubavitch World Headquarters in New York City.

events.title: Trump threatens to end Iraq support over al-Maliki comeback bid tied to Iran influence
events.description: U.S. opposes Iran-backed al-Maliki's bid for Iraqi PM role as Secretary of State Marco Rubio expresses concerns about pro-Tehran government seizing control of Iraq.

events.title: Trump says government will 'de-escalate' in Minnesota following Pretti shooting
events.description: The killing of Alex Pretti over the weekend led Minnesota officials and locals to renew calls for Trump to end his immigration operation there.

events.title: Why is ‚ÄòDeuce Bigalow‚Äô rooting for Viktor Orban in Hungary?
events.description: A washed-up American comedian‚Äôs endorsement offers a window into Hungary‚Äôs central role in the global far right.

events.title: Sabalenka defeats Svitolina to reach Australian Open final
events.description: World No 1 Aryna Sabalenka is through to her fourth straight Australian Open final with victory against Elina Svitolina.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer Fran√ßois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing called for a "comprehensive strategic partnership" to deepen ties amid global uncertainty.

events.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
events.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

events.title: Interim Venezuelan leader says it's been "enough" orders from Washington
events.description: In Venezuela, the post-Maduro transition is underway. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio recently touted quick progress and opening communication channels between the countries. However, the level of US influence over the country's future leadership remains to be tested, with interim leader Delcy Rodriguez recently saying it's been "enough" orders from Washington. As the military pledged allegiance to Rodriguez Wednesday, she seemed to hit back at opposition leader Maria Corina Machado's comment that "no one has faith" in Rodriguez, made following talks with Rubio in Washington.

events.title: Landslide causes homes to fall off cliff edge
events.description: Heavy rain has tiggered a landslide in southern Sicily causing the edge of a town to collapse and forcing the evacuation of more than 1,500 people.

events.title: Amazon to axe thousands of jobs globally
events.description: Amazon has told staff it plans to cut around 16,000 jobs globally as part of efforts to streamline operations and reduce bureaucracy across the business.

events.title: UN food agency is shutting down operations in rebel-held northern Yemen, officials say
events.description: U.N. officials say the World Food Program is shutting down its operations in northern, rebel-held part of Yemen

events.title: German leader hails Europe as an 'alternative to imperialism and autocracy'
events.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz says the European Union can be an ‚Äúalternative to imperialism and autocracy‚Äù and can forge deals with like-minded partners in a world of increasing great power rivalry

events.title: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties as US tariffs reshape global trade
events.description: Vietnam and the European Union have upgraded their relationship to a comprehensive strategic partnership, Vietnam‚Äôs highest diplomatic level

events.title: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership as Trump tariffs reshape global trade
events.description: Vietnam and the EU upgrade ties to a comprehensive strategic partnership as Trump tariffs reshape global trade

events.title: Starmer and Xi call for deeper UK-China ties as Trump shakes up global relations
events.description: The leaders of Britain and China have called for a ‚Äúcomprehensive strategic partnership‚Äù to deepen ties amid global uncertainty

events.title: Young people must be ‚Äòtruly involved‚Äô in transforming education
events.description: With young people under 30 making up more than half of the global population and over 272 million children and youth still out of school, their participation in shaping education is becoming increasingly vital.

events.title: Pope Leo calls for world free from persecution while honoring Holocaust victims
events.description: Pope Leo calls Holocaust Remembrance Day a "painful remembrance" during a Vatican audience, urging vigilance against genocide and building societies rooted in respect.

events.title: Talks ramp up to avert US government shutdown after Minneapolis shooting
events.description: Democrats are pushing to remove funding for the Department of Homeland Security unless new measures are implemented.

events.title: Flights to northern Ethiopia cancelled as fears mount of renewed conflict
events.description: Passengers received a text message about the cancellation of flights, citing "unforeseen circumstances".

events.title: 'I don't let bullies win,' says US congresswoman Omar after substance thrown at her
events.description: The Minnesota Democrat was uninjured and continued to speak at her event, after being sprayed with an unidentified liquid.

events.title: 'I couldn't save them' - US mum's horror as three sons die falling through pond ice
events.description: Their mother says she tried to rescue them by lifting them out but the ice kept breaking.

events.title: Family blames ICE for disabled son‚Äôs death after father‚Äôs detention
events.description: Wael Tarabishi died after weeks in intensive care while his father, his primary caregiver, was held in ICE detention.

events.title: Mbappe blasts Real Madrid after Champions League loss at Benfica
events.description: French forward Kylian Mbappe questions team‚Äôs desire after damaging defeat sends Real Madrid into playoffs.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
events.description: Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities. Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Five-year-old deported to Honduras despite being US citizen is latest child victim of Trump crackdown
events.description: Mother whose visa application was pending says she will send girl back to US soon accompanied by another relative Five-year-old G√©nesis Ester Guti√©rrez Castellanos misses her cousins, classmates and kindergarten teachers in Austin, Texas. Despite being a US citizen, she was deported on 11 January alongside her mother, Karen Guadalupe Guti√©rrez Castellanos, to Honduras, a country G√©nesis had never known. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents were acting on an administrative deportation order against Guti√©rrez, 26, issued in 2019, before G√©nesis was born. Continue reading...

events.title: Two friends, an Israeli and a Palestinian, believe peace is possible after war
events.description: A Palestinian man and his Israeli friend are dedicating themselves to a peaceful coexistence in the aftermath of the devastating war in Gaza.

events.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
events.description: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

events.title: China executes 11 people tied to Myanmar scam compounds
events.description: The 11 members of gangs based in northern Myanmar were sentenced to death in September. Beijing has been cracking down on cyberscam compounds in Southeast Asia in recent years.

events.title: Sicily landslide forces evacuation of 1,500
events.description: A landslide in southern Sicily has homes balanced at the edge of a cliff following days of rain. Officials have said some people won't be able to return to living in their homes.

events.title: US Youtuber IShowSpeed gains Ghanaian nationality to end African tour
events.description: US Youtuber IShowSpeed is the latest member of the diaspora to be granted Ghanaian citizenship. The announcement that the 21-year-old American would become a national was made on January 28 as he wrapped up a wildly popular month-long tour of the continent. This is in line with Ghana's strategy; part of a programme launched in 2019 where it is aggressively encouraging members of the African diaspora to return. FRANCE 24's Ghanaian correspondent Justice Baidoo has more.

events.title: Supporters of French journalist imprisoned in Algeria to rally in Paris
events.description: Support is growing in France for jailed journalist Christophe Gleizes. Condemned on appeal to seven years in prison in Algeria, the French sports reporter is now the focus of a high-profile support evening in Paris. Musicians, journalists and sports figures are set to gather in the French capital, as press freedom group Reporters Without Borders steps up calls for his release.

events.title: UN says Gaza crisis remains dire, children hardest hit
events.description: Despite a modest increase in humanitarian assistance, the situation in Gaza remains ‚Äúdire‚Äù, with children among the hardest hit by shortages of shelter, basic services and education, the United Nations said on Tuesday.

events.title: Between fear and survival: Women and girls flee violence in northern Syria
events.description: When fighting recently intensified near her neighbourhood in Aleppo, in northern Syria, Fatima and her family had to run.

events.title: Keeping people warm amid hostilities and harsh winter weather in Ukraine
events.description: As people in war-torn Ukraine face the coldest winter in more than a decade, authorities and humanitarians are working to help them stay warm, particularly the most vulnerable residents.

events.title: Texas killer asks victims' families for forgiveness before becoming first execution of 2026
events.description: Texas carried out the nation‚Äôs first execution of the year, putting to death a man convicted of killing his ex-girlfriend and her new boyfriend in a 1998 double murder.

events.title: Career criminal accused of killing elderly woman in violent home invasion after skipping court days earlier
events.description: Texas man with prior convictions allegedly kills elderly woman during home invasion days after missing court appearance. Both suspects shot by victim.

events.title: DHS honors Illinois woman whose corpse was allegedly abused by illegal immigrant freed under sanctuary laws
events.description: DHS honored an Illinois woman, Megan Bos, who was allegedly killed by an illegal immigrant who walked free under sanctuary laws before an ICE arrest.

events.title: From 700 murdered relatives to 3 survivors: Holocaust descendant leads Israeli forces after Oct 7 attacks
events.description: Israeli colonel whose parents survived Holocaust continues military service at the age of 56, serving over 3,600 days in reserves including Gaza operations.

events.title: The return of inflation may poison Labor‚Äôs second-term agenda and scare more voters to the fringes
events.description: As economic grievance grows in the electorate, an interest rate hike is the last thing our fraught politics needs Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Cost of living has been bubbling along as the number-one issue for Australian households, and now it threatens to hijack the Albanese government‚Äôs second-term agenda. The return of high and rising inflation is not only a blow to workers who were finally starting to see some real growth in their wages through 2025. It also risks further polarising and antagonising our already fraught politics. Continue reading...

events.title: A new blow for UNRWA as headquarters in East Jerusalem 'set on fire'
events.description: The head of embattled UN relief agency for Palestinians, UNRWA, has condemned reports that its headquarters in East Jerusalem have been set alight deliberately.

events.title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar scam mafia
events.description: China executes 11 members of the Ming family that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

events.title: China bans 73 and punishes top football clubs in latest corruption scandal
events.description: China's former football chief and national team coach are among 73 to receive lifetime bans for match-fixing.

events.title: Israel raids several occupied West Bank towns after killing Hebron youth
events.description: Raids come as Israeli settlers storm Joseph's Tomb in Nablus, said to be the burial ground of biblical father of Jesus.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Mexico‚Äôs president says cancellation of oil shipment to Cuba is ‚Äòsovereign‚Äô decision
events.description: Claudia Sheinbaum denied move was response to pressure from the US, after Trump said ‚Äòzero‚Äô oil would go to Cuba Mexico has cancelled a shipment of oil to Cuba , the country‚Äôs president, Claudia Sheinbaum, appeared to confirm on Tuesday, but she insisted the decision was ‚Äúsovereign‚Äù and not a response to pressure from the US. Fuel shortages are causing increasingly severe blackouts in Cuba, and Mexico has been the island‚Äôs biggest oil supplier since the US blocked shipments from Venezuela last month. Continue reading...

events.title: Xi-Starmer meeting: Chinese leader tells PM he hopes both countries can ‚Äòrise above differences‚Äô
events.description: China agrees visa-free travel for British citizens as countries sign agreements on closer economic cooperation UK politics live ‚Äì latest updates The Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, has said the UK‚Äôs relationship with his country has gone through ‚Äútwists and turns‚Äù over the years but that a more ‚Äúconsistent‚Äù approach is in both their interests. Ahead of talks with Keir Starmer during the first visit to China by a British prime minister in eight years, Xi said the two men would ‚Äústand the test of history‚Äù if they could ‚Äúrise above differences‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: China executes 11 people linked to Myanmar scam operation
events.description: Beijing has stepped up cooperation with south-east Asian nations to crack down on the multibillion-dollar industry China on Thursday executed 11 people linked to Myanmar criminal gangs, including ‚Äúkey members‚Äù involved in scam operations, state media reported. Scam compounds have flourished in Myanmar‚Äôs lawless borderlands, part of a multibillion-dollar illicit industry. Continue reading...

events.title: Chinese man who filmed evidence of Xinjiang rights abuses is granted asylum in US
events.description: Lawyer for Guan Heng, whose exposed evidence of persecution of Uyghurs, says he is ‚Äòtextbook example of why asylum should exist‚Äô A US immigration judge has granted asylum to a Chinese national who he said had a ‚Äúwell founded fear‚Äù of persecution if sent back to China after exposing alleged human rights abuses against Uyghurs there. Guan Heng applied for asylum after arriving in the US illegally in 2021. He has been in custody since being swept up in an immigration enforcement operation in August last year as part of a mass deportation campaign by the Trump administration. Continue reading...

events.title: Spain will grant legal status to immigrants lacking authorization
events.description: Spain's government announced Tuesday it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization.

events.title: Confusion, anger in post-coup Guinea-Bissau
events.description: The opposition alleges that the ousted president staged his own coup to avoid defeat in the last election. Meanwhile, the country's political institutions have been left in limbo as the country gears up for fresh polls.

events.title: US Fed keeps rates unchanged despite Trump pressure
events.description: The Federal Reserve has decided to keep interest rates between 3.5% and 3.75%. Two Fed governors voted against the move, and instead backed a rate cut, while 10 officials were in favor of leaving rates the same.

events.title: Rwanda sues the UK over controversial migrant deal
events.description: Rwanda has said it is suing the United Kingdom in the Hague Court to seek payments over an aborted, controversial migrant deal under which it was to host deported asylum seekers from the European country. The migrant deal entered into force on April 25, 2024. In July 2024, shortly after taking office, the UK‚Äôs new Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced that the deal was ‚Äúdead and buried.‚Äù FRANCE 24's Juliette Montilly tells us about the controversial deal.

events.title: Pakistan says imprisoned ex-PM Imran Khan 'in good health' after eye procedure
events.description: Pakistan‚Äôs imprisoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan underwent a medical procedure for an eye ailment last week at a government hospital in the capital and is in good health, Information Minister Attaullah Tarar said

events.title: Bangladesh's ousted leader Hasina denounces the upcoming election from her exile in India
events.description: Bangladesh‚Äôs ousted leader Sheikh Hasina has slammed the country‚Äôs upcoming election after her party was barred from the polls, remarks that could deepen tensions ahead of the pivotal vote next month

events.title: Rwanda sues the UK over controversial migrant deal
events.description: Rwanda has said it is suing the United Kingdom to seek payments over an aborted, controversial migrant deal under which the East African nation was to host deported asylum seekers from the European country

events.title: Independent experts alarmed by child rights violations in US immigration procedures
events.description: UN-appointed independent human rights experts have raised alarm over violations of children‚Äôs rights during US immigration procedures, nearly a year after federal funding for legal representation for unaccompanied minors was terminated.

events.title: Federal judge gives man 15 years for Iran-backed assassination plot on US soil
events.description: Federal judge sentences would-be assassin to maximum 15 years for plotting to kill Iranian American journalist Masih Alinejad for Iran's government.

events.title: What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios
events.description: From regime change to retaliation, the BBC's Frank Gardner outlines possible outcomes of US strikes on Iran.

events.title: Nicki Minaj calls herself Trump's 'number one fan' and shows off gold card visa
events.description: The Trinidadian-American rapper held hands on stage with the US President, amid ICE protests.

events.title: Amazon confirms 16,000 job cuts after accidental email
events.description: The technology giant confirmed the redundancies hours after it told staff in an email sent in error.

events.title: Panic on crowded Ukraine train - passenger describes moment of Russian drone strike
events.description: The BBC speaks to a person who was aboard a train on which five people died after it was targeted by drones.

events.title: Anti-ICE protesters tear-gassed outside Texas detention centre
events.description: Anti-ICE protesters tear-gassed outside Texas detention centre

events.title: U.S. allies looking to China for deals as Trump threats them with tariffs
events.description: President Trump's tariffs and rhetoric have spurred some longtime U.S. allies to diversify their trade ties away from the U.S. Some are going cap-in-hand to Asian superpowers China and India.

events.title: Court faults Netherlands over Caribbean island climate risks
events.description: Judges have ruled that the Dutch government has been failing to adequately protect its citizens on the island of Bonaire from climate threats.

events.title: Plane crash kills 15 including politician
events.description: A small passenger plane has crashed in northern Colombia, killing all 15 people on board, including a congressman.

events.title: Gaza ceasefire improves aid access, but children still face deadly conditions
events.description: The fragile ceasefire in the Gaza Strip is making a difference to the lives of over a million children, and improving overall access to food - but more aid still needs to enter.

events.title: Medical watchdog unloads on VCU after nurse fired for viral anti-ICE TikTok video suggested drugging agents
events.description: VCU nurse fired after viral TikTok videos showed her suggesting harmful tactics against ICE agents, sparking widespread medical watchdog outrage.

events.title: UK reopens Chagos Islands talks with US following Trump criticism of deal: reports
events.description: Chagos Islands talks between U.K. and U.S. reopened after President Donald Trump called the Mauritius deal an "act of great stupidity" as British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says discussions have resumed.

events.title: Iran-US tensions soar: What do both sides want?
events.description: From enriched uranium and ballistic missiles to sanctions and regional influence, the differences are many.

events.title: Israel seeks ‚Äòmore exits than entries‚Äô at Gaza‚Äôs Rafah as Egypt objects
events.description: Demands from Israel fuel fears of engineered displacement of Palestinians from devastated Gaza.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Marco Rubio defends Trump's Venezuela policy in heated hearing
events.description: The top US diplomat testified before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. In early January, the United States seized Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro in an operation and brought him to New York to face charges.

events.title: US says aid will resume while Somali officials deny causing disruption leading to suspension
events.description: The United States say it is lifting a suspension of aid to Somalia

events.title: Latin American leaders call for unity against growing political polarization
events.description: Latin American leaders have gathered for a development forum, calling for regional unity amid increasing political polarization and recent U.S. intervention in Venezuela

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Ros√© used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.description: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and players banned after African Cup final chaos
events.description: Africa's soccer body issued fines worth more than $1 million and banned Senegal's coach and Senegalese and Morocco players Wednesday following a shambolic African Cup soccer final this month.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.description: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: What is Nipah virus? The highly lethal disease causing concern across Asia
events.description: Airports across Asia have put urgent steps in place to stop the spread of a highly lethal virus.

events.title: Assailant convicted after Barron Trump calls London police to report crime he saw on video
events.description: A Russian man has been convicted in a London court of beating a woman in a crime reported by the youngest son of U.S. President Donald Trump

events.title: Limited access restored to Syria‚Äôs Al Hol camp amid security concerns
events.description: United Nations agencies have regained limited access to Syria‚Äôs Al Hol camp and resumed the delivery of essential supplies after days of disruption caused by a volatile security situation, the UN Deputy Spokesperson said on Friday.

events.title: Former North Carolina elections official allegedly drugged teens' ice cream: report
events.description: Former North Carolina elections official allegedly placed pills in teens' ice cream cones, facing felony charges after grand jury indictment.

events.title: China infiltrates key Pacific territory of Micronesia with infrastructure projects as US urged to act
events.description: China opens new runway in Micronesia's Yap islands, raising serious U.S. defense concerns in this strategically vital Pacific region amid growing tensions.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Yemen: Security Council votes on final extension of Hudaydah Mission
events.description: The Security Council adopted a resolution on Tuesday that renews the mandate of the UN Mission in the Yemeni port city of Hudaydah for a final two-month period through 31 March of this year.

events.title: Indians pay tribute after Arijit Singh retires at 38 as Bollywood singer
events.description: Singh has been one of the most loved and recognisable voices of Bollywood for more than a decade.

events.title: Europe must act urgently and stop outsourcing defence, says EU's Kallas
events.description: The EU foreign policy chief's remarks come days after Nato's secretary general said Europe needed the US for its defence.

events.title: Deutsche Bank offices raided in money laundering probe
events.description: Officials searched offices in Frankfurt and Berlin in relation to "past business relationships".

events.title: Ecuador says ICE agent attempted to enter its Minneapolis consulate
events.description: A complaint has been filed by Ecuador, whose consular staff prevented the agent from entering.

events.title: US YouTube star IShowSpeed to get Ghanaian passport as Africa tour ends
events.description: Ghana's foreign minister says the influencer is a "worthy ambassador", but some Ghanaians criticised the move.

events.title: Why is the UK‚Äôs Keir Starmer in China and what does he want to achieve?
events.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has portrayed his trip as a pragmatic move to improve UK-China relations.

events.title: Video: Palestinians in Gaza wait for vital Rafah crossing to open
events.description: Palestinians in Gaza are waiting with uncertainty for the partial Israeli reopening of Gaza‚Äôs Rafah border crossing.

events.title: Video emerges of Dutch police assault on two Muslim women
events.description: Two Muslim women who were kicked and hit by a police officer in Utrecht have made a formal complaint.

events.title: Italy‚Äôs Winter Olympics security plan keeps ICE in advisory role
events.description: Italy to control Olympic security operations with 6,000 officers, drones and cyberunit, but ICE will be present.

events.title: ‚ÄòWael‚Äôs last wish‚Äô: Man detained by ICE denied release for son‚Äôs funeral
events.description: Maher Tarabishi's ailing son Wael died as he sat in a detention facility. His family says ICE is responsible.

events.title: What we know about the US-proposed Gaza community
events.description: Israeli and US officials are preparing to build Gaza‚Äôs first experimental community.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco handed fines and bans after AFCON final farce
events.description: Fines together total more than $1m, and players from both teams banned after Africa Cup of Nations walk-off and chaos.

events.title: Clashes between government troops and Tigrayan forces erupt in Ethiopia
events.description: 'Deteriorating' situation causes suspension of flights, security and diplomatic sources say.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship ‚Äî and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news

events.title: Canadian ex-Olympian pleads not guilty to 17 felonies including drug trafficking
events.description: Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, 44, ‚Äòturned to a life of crime‚Äô after his snowboarding career ended Ryan Wedding, the Canadian former Olympic snowboarder accused of cocaine distribution and orchestrating several murders, appeared on Monday in a southern California courtroom for arraignment. The 44-year-old has been charged with drug trafficking, conspiracy to murder, witness tampering and money laundering, among other charges. Authorities allege that after his snowboarding career, Wedding ‚Äúturned to a life of crime‚Äù as a narcotics trafficker and led an organization that moved cocaine from South America to the US and Canada. Continue reading...

events.title: A cabal of male Liberals signals Ley‚Äôs reign is ending. But the day of a colleague‚Äôs memorial is obscene timing

First, the internal plot to oust Sussan Ley has descended into a political melodrama. Continue reading...

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.description: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.description: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.description: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Germany updates: 'We are not subordinates' ‚Äì Merz
events.description: In a foreign policy address, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has called on Europe to stand up in the face of US belligerence and slammed US Donald Trump's criticism of NATO troops in Afghanistan. DW has more.

events.title: UK's Keir Starmer visits China as Beijing courts US allies
events.description: Keir Starmer is in China for the first trip by a British prime minister since 2018. He is the latest in a string of European leaders to visit recently, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz soon to follow.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.description: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: Budapest mayor charged over Pride parade
events.description: Prosecutors in Hungary are moving against Budapest‚Äôs mayor, Gergely Karacsony, after last year's Pride went ahead despite a police ban. The case is being handled without a court hearing and as elections approach.

events.title: Champions League round of 16 completed after 18-game night
events.description: It was a much-anticipated evening for football fans: 18 games, played simultaneously to close off the regular season of the Champions League. The matches brought surprise victories and upsets. PSG, Real Madrid and Inter Milan will all have to go through the playoffs, while Benefica eliminated Marseille at the last second. PSG and Real Madrid will have to compete in the two playoff games in February to reach March's round of 16, unlike Arsenal who have had a flawless season.

events.title: China executes 11 members of scam mafia family
events.description: China has executed 11 members of a mafia family for killing 14 people and running a crime syndicate worth more than $1bn, authorities said.

events.title: Tyson Fury announces comeback fight - and it'll screen on Netflix
events.description: Tyson Fury has confirmed his return to boxing with a comeback fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov.

events.title: South Korea's former first lady jailed for 20 months for corruption
events.description: The wife of South Korea's former president Yoon Suk Yeol - who was ousted over a martial law bid - has been jailed for 20 months for corruption.

events.title: China executes 11 members of Myanmar-based group in crackdown on scam operations
events.description: China has executed 11 people it found guilty of killing 14 Chinese citizens and running scam and gambling operations worth more than $1 billion

events.title: ASEAN does not recognize military-ruled Myanmar's elections, top Philippine diplomat says
events.description: The Philippine foreign secretary says the Association of Southeast Asian Nations does not recognize the recently held elections in Myanmar, the first since the army seized power in 2021

events.title: What to know about Gaza's Rafah crossing, which could open within days
events.description: The Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt could open within days

events.title: Chaos erupts in Somalia's parliament over proposed constitutional amendments
events.description: Scuffles and shouting erupted during a joint session of Somalia‚Äôs parliament on Wednesday

events.title: From family farm to climate tech: How one Kenyan woman is helping farmers outsmart drought
events.description: ‚ÄúGiving up is not an option - so many people depend on you,‚Äù the words of Maryanne Gichanga, a participant in a UN supported initiative, which aims to help farmers in Kenya find solutions to alleviate the pressures of climate change on agriculture production.

events.title: Georgia assistant principal accused of stealing nearly $1K in Walmart merchandise at self-checkout
events.description: Georgia assistant principal allegedly caught shoplifting $1,000 worth of items from Walmart using self-checkout "stacking" method. Educator placed on leave.

events.title: China executes 11 people convicted in scam crackdown
events.description: Chinese authorities on Thursday announced they executed 11 people convicted in a massive cross-border fraud scheme worth roughly $1.4 billion.

events.title: Spain legalizes up to 500,000 undocumented migrants, sparking backlash
events.description: Spain announced plans to grant legal status to 500,000 undocumented migrants over three years, taking the opposite approach from Trump's border crackdown.

events.title: French lawmakers declare 'battle for free minds' after approving social media ban for children under 15
events.description: French lawmakers paved the way for a bill banning social media for children under 15, following Australia's lead in protecting children from digital harm.

events.title: Witkoff celebrates 'new day in the Middle East' after final Israeli hostage is returned from Gaza
events.description: All hostages from Gaza have returned home as Trump administration completes historic Middle East diplomatic achievement, marking end of painful chapter.

events.title: North Korea launches short-range ballistic missiles into sea, show of force ahead of political meetings
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's regime tests ballistic missiles as tensions rise in the region ahead of a massive political party gathering.
